intro: Lasianthera javanica, commonly known as the Java lasianthera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
